userInterface

Class Lab

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • userInterface.Lab
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Level

    public class Lab
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Virtual Optics

    This class displays a panel in which users can experiment with optical objects

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • overlap

        public boolean overlap(java.util.ArrayList<GameComponent> components,
              int deltaX,
              int deltaY,
              int current)
        checks if two components are about to overlap, using their bounding boxes
        Parameters:
        components - list of active components
        deltaX - amount by which the component is about to be moved in the x direction
        deltaY - amount by which the component is about to be moved in the y direction
        current - index of the component that is currently being moved
        Returns:
        true if they are about to overlap, false otherwise

      • indices

        public void indices()
        only applies to refractive zones checks if any 2 zones intersect, and adjusts their positions consequently also updates the values of the outer refractive indices of each zone

      • reposition

        public void reposition(GameComponent comp1,
              GameComponent comp2,
              boolean pushIn)
        updates the position of one component relative to another such that its position is a valid one
        Parameters:
        comp1 - first game component
        comp2 - second game component
        pushIn - tells whether comp1 should be pushed in or out of comp2

      • repositionAll

        public void repositionAll()
        spreads out components on the plane to put them in valid positions that is, so that no 2 components overlap
